Please accept the permission to make call
Yes
No
Please call National helpline(1075) below immediately if you are experiencing any of the following
If you belong to any of these you are in at-risk group. Maintain good health and practice self isolation
Follow all government guidelines and instructions
Please call local Corona help centre to take necessary steps to ensure your well-being if

• severe difficulty breathing
• severe chest pain
• confusion (for example, unsure of where you are)
• lost consciousness

• I am over 70 years of age
• I have a condition that affects my immune system (for example, HIV/AIDS)
• I have a chronic health condition (for example, diabetes, heart condition)
• I am getting treatment that affects my immune system (for example, chemotherapy)
Visit MyGov.in for up to date information about COVID-19\nPractice Self distancing for well-being of self and society
\u2022 If you have travelled outside of India in the last 14 days\n\u2022 or came in contact with such a person\n\u2022 have someone you are in close contact with tested positive for COVID-19
Wash your hands regularly for 20 seconds, with soap and water or alcohol-based hand rub
Cover your nose and mouth with a disposable tissue or flexed elbow when you cough or sneeze
Avoid close contact (2 meter or 6 feet) with people who are unwell
Don`t Touch your eyes, nose, or mouth if your hands are not clean
